metadata.Title: CVE-2019-1348 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was found in Git before v2.24.1, v2.23.1, v2.22.2, v2.21.1, v2.20.2, v2.19.3, v2.18.2, v2.17.3, v2.16.6, v2.15.4, and v2.14.6. The --export-marks option of git fast-import is exposed also via the in-stream command feature export-marks=... and it allows overwriting arbitrary paths. The --export-marks option of git fast-import is exposed also via the in-stream command feature export-marks=... and it allows overwriting arbitrary paths.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-1348` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

git - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.5
git-all - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.5
git-cvs - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.5
git-daemon-run - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.5
git-daemon-sysvinit - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.5
git-el - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.5
git-email - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.5
git-gui - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.5
git-man - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.5
git-mediawiki - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.5
git-svn - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.5
gitk - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.5
gitweb - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.5
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

advisory.DiscoveredBy: Nicolas Joly of Microsoft Security Response Center

criterions.comment: git package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.5').
